rule.description: Detect changes in auditd configuration files.
Detects change of user environment. Adversaries can insert code into these files to gain persistence each time a user logs in or opens a new shell.
Detects change of user environment. Adversaries can insert code into these files to gain persistence each time a user logs in or opens a new shell.
Detects attempts to record audio with arecord utility.
Adversaries may use binary padding to add junk data and change the on-disk representation of malware. This rule detect using dd and truncate to add a junk data to file.
Adversaries may use binary padding to add junk data and change the on-disk representation of malware. This rule detect using dd and truncate to add a junk data to file.
Detects BPFDoor .lock and .pid files access in temporary file storage facility.
All TCP traffic on particular port from attacker is routed to different port. ex. '/sbin/iptables -t nat -D PREROUTING -p tcp -s 192.168.1.1 --dport 22 -j REDIRECT --to-ports 42392'.
All TCP traffic on particular port from attacker is routed to different port. ex. '/sbin/iptables -t nat -D PREROUTING -p tcp -s 192.168.1.1 --dport 22 -j REDIRECT --to-ports 42392'.
Detects attempts to discover the files with setuid/setgid capability on them. That would allow adversary to escalate their privileges.
Detect file time attribute change to hide new or changes to existing files.
Detects attempts to collect data stored in the clipboard from users with the usage of xclip tool.
Detects command line parameter very often used with coin miners.
Detects command line parameter very often used with coin miners.
Detects command line parameter very often used with coin miners.
Detects command line parameter very often used with coin miners.
Detects command line parameter very often used with coin miners.
Detects command line parameter very often used with coin miners.
Detects command line parameter very often used with coin miners.
Detects exploitation attempt of vulnerability described in CVE-2021-3156.
Detects exploitation attempt of vulnerability described in CVE-2021-3156.
An adversary may compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.
An adversary may compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.
An adversary may compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.

Detects attempts to post the file with the usage of wget utility. The adversary can bypass the permission restriction with the misconfigured sudo permission for wget utility which could allow them to read files like /etc/shadow.
Detects overwriting (effectively wiping/deleting) of a file.
Detects access to a raw disk on a host to evade detection by security products.
Detects disabling of system firewalls which could be used by adversaries to bypass controls that limit usage of the network.
Detects file and folder permission changes.
Detecting attempts to extract passwords with grep.
Detecting attempts to extract passwords with grep.
Detects adversary creating hidden file or directory, by detecting directories or files with . as the first character.
Detects adversary creating hidden file or directory, by detecting directories or files with . as the first character.
Detects appending of zip file to image.
Identifies modification of ld.so.preload for shared object injection. This technique is used by attackers to load arbitrary code into processes.
Detects loading of kernel modules with insmod command.
Detect changes of syslog daemons configuration files.
Detects enumeration of local or remote network services.
Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection.
Detects password policy discovery commands used to enumerate password requirements and policies.
Detects a reload or a start of a service.
Detects adversary creating screen capture of a desktop with Import Tool.
Detects adversary creating screen capture of a desktop with Import Tool.
Detects adversary creating screen capture of a full with xwd.
Detects adversary creating screen capture of a full with xwd.
Detection use of the command "split" to split files into parts and possible transfer.
Detects embeding of files with usage of steghide binary, the adversaries may use this technique to prevent the detection of hidden information.
Detects extraction of files with usage of steghide binary, the adversaries may use this technique to prevent the detection of hidden information.

Detects suspicious activities as declared by Florian Roth in its 'Best Practice Auditd Configuration'. This includes the detection of the following commands; wget, curl, base64, nc, netcat, ncat, ssh, socat, wireshark, rawshark, rdesktop, nmap.
Detects relevant commands often related to malware or hacking activity.
Detects program executions in suspicious non-program folders related to malware or hacking activity.
Detects commandline operations on shell history files.
Detects a creation of systemd services which could be used by adversaries to execute malicious code.
Detects extracting of zip file from image file.

Adversaries may use the information from System Owner/User Discovery during automated discovery to shape follow-on behaviors, including whether or not the adversary fully infects the target and/or attempts specific actions.
Clipboard Collection with Xclip Tool - Auditd
Clipboard Collection of Image Data with Xclip Tool
Possible Coin Miner CPU Priority Param
Possible Coin Miner CPU Priority Param
Possible Coin Miner CPU Priority Param
Possible Coin Miner CPU Priority Param
Possible Coin Miner CPU Priority Param
Possible Coin Miner CPU Priority Param
Possible Coin Miner CPU Priority Param
Overwriting the File with Dev Zero or Null
Steganography Hide Zip Information in Picture File
Steganography Unzip Hidden Information From Picture File
System Owner or User Discovery - Linux
Auditing Configuration Changes on Linux Host
BPFDoor Abnormal Process ID or Lock File Accessed
Use Of Hidden Paths Or Files
Logging Configuration Changes on Linux Host
Loading of Kernel Module via Insmod
Split A File Into Pieces - Linux
Guacamole Two Users Sharing Session Anomaly

rule.field: (?:(?i)chown root\*chmod 4777 |(?i)cp /bin/sh \.;chown|(?i)chmod 4777 /tmp/\.scsi/dev/bin/gsh|(?i)chown root:root /tmp/\.scsi/dev/bin/|(?i)chown root:root x;|(?i)/bin/telnet locip locport < /dev/console \| /bin/sh|(?i)/tmp/ratload|(?i)ewok -t |(?i)xspy -display |(?i)cat > /dev/tcp/127\.0\.0\.1/80 <<END|(?i)rm -f /current/tmp/ftshell\.latest|(?i)ghost_\* -v |(?i) --wipe > /dev/null|(?i)ping -c 2 \*; grep \* /proc/net/arp >/tmp/gx|(?i)iptables \* OUTPUT -p tcp -d 127\.0\.0\.1 --tcp-flags RST RST -j DROP;|(?i)> /var/log/audit/audit\.log; rm -f \.|(?i)cp /var/log/audit/audit\.log \.tmp|(?i)sh >/dev/tcp/\* <&1 2>&1|(?i)ncat -vv -l -p \* <|(?i)nc -vv -l -p \* <|(?i)< /dev/console \| uudecode && uncompress|(?i)sendmail -osendmail;chmod \+x sendmail|(?i)/usr/bin/wget -O /tmp/a http\* && chmod 755 /tmp/cron|(?i)chmod 666 /var/run/utmp~|(?i)chmod 700 nscd crond|(?i)cp /etc/shadow /tmp/\.|(?i)</dev/console \|uudecode > /dev/null 2>&1 && uncompress|(?i)chmod 700 jp&&netstat -an\|grep|(?i)uudecode > /dev/null 2>&1 && uncompress -f \* && chmod 755|(?i)chmod 700 crond|(?i)wget http\*; chmod \+x /tmp/sendmail|(?i)chmod 700 fp sendmail pt|(?i)chmod 755 /usr/vmsys/bin/pipe|(?i)chmod -R 755 /usr/vmsys|(?i)chmod 755 \$opbin/\*tunnel|(?i)chmod 700 sendmail|(?i)chmod 0700 sendmail|(?i)/usr/bin/wget http\*sendmail;chmod \+x sendmail;|(?i)&& telnet \* 2>&1 </dev/console)
(?:(?i)attempt to execute code on stack by|(?i)0bin0sh1|(?i)AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA|(?i)stack smashing detected)

rule.description: Commands to Clear or Remove the Syslog - Builtin

rule.field: (?:(?i)wget \* - http\* \| perl|(?i)wget \* - http\* \| sh|(?i)wget \* - http\* \| bash|(?i)python -m SimpleHTTPServer|(?i)-m http\.server|(?i)import pty; pty\.spawn\*|(?i)socat exec:\*|(?i)socat -O /tmp/\*|(?i)socat tcp-connect\*|(?i)\*echo binary >>\*|(?i)\*wget \*; chmod \+x\*|(?i)\*wget \*; chmod 777 \*|(?i)\*cd /tmp \|\| cd /var/run \|\| cd /mnt\*|(?i)\*stop;service iptables stop;\*|(?i)\*stop;SuSEfirewall2 stop;\*|(?i)chmod 777 2020\*|(?i)\*>>/etc/rc\.local|(?i)\*base64 -d /tmp/\*|(?i)\* \| base64 -d \*|(?i)\*/chmod u\+s \*|(?i)\*chmod \+s /tmp/\*|(?i)\*chmod u\+s /tmp/\*|(?i)\* /tmp/haxhax\*|(?i)\* /tmp/ns_sploit\*|(?i)nc -l -p \*|(?i)cp /bin/ksh \*|(?i)cp /bin/sh \*|(?i)\* /tmp/\*\.b64 \*|(?i)\*/tmp/ysocereal\.jar\*|(?i)\*/tmp/x \*|(?i)\*; chmod \+x /tmp/\*|(?i)\*;chmod \+x /tmp/\*)
(?:(?i)entered promiscuous mode|(?i)Deactivating service|(?i)Oversized packet received from|(?i)imuxsock begins to drop messages)

(?:(?i)BEGIN \{s = "/inet/tcp/0/|(?i)bash -i >& /dev/tcp/|(?i)bash -i >& /dev/udp/|(?i)sh -i >\$ /dev/udp/|(?i)sh -i >\$ /dev/tcp/|(?i)&& while read line 0<&5; do|(?i)/bin/bash -c exec 5<>/dev/tcp/|(?i)/bin/bash -c exec 5<>/dev/udp/|(?i)nc -e /bin/sh |(?i)/bin/sh \| nc|(?i)rm -f backpipe; mknod /tmp/backpipe p && nc |(?i);socket\(S,PF_INET,SOCK_STREAM,getprotobyname\("tcp"\)\);if\(connect\(S,sockaddr_in\(\$p,inet_aton\(\$i\)\)\)\)|(?i);STDIN->fdopen\(\$c,r\);\$~->fdopen\(\$c,w\);system\$_ while<>;|(?i)/bin/sh -i <&3 >&3 2>&3|(?i)uname -a; w; id; /bin/bash -i|(?i)\$sendbyte = \(\[text\.encoding\]::ASCII\)\.GetBytes\(\$sendback2\); \$stream\.Write\(\$sendbyte,0,\$sendbyte\.Length\); \$stream\.Flush\(\)\};|(?i);os\.dup2\(s\.fileno\(\),0\);os\.dup2\(s\.fileno\(\),1\);os\.dup2\(s\.fileno\(\),2\);os\.putenv\('HISTFILE','/dev/null'\);|(?i)\.to_i;exec sprintf\("/bin/sh -i <&%d >&%d 2>&%d",f,f,f\)|(?i);while\(cmd=c\.gets\);IO\.popen\(cmd,"r"\)\{\|io\|c\.print|(?i)socat exec:'bash -li',pty,stderr,setsid,sigint,sane tcp:|(?i)rm -f /tmp/p; mknod /tmp/p p &&|(?i) \| /bin/bash \| telnet |(?i),echo=0,raw tcp-listen:|(?i)nc -lvvp |(?i)xterm -display 1)

(?:(?i)unexpected internal error|(?i)unknown or unsupported key type|(?i)invalid certificate signing key|(?i)invalid elliptic curve value|(?i)incorrect signature|(?i)error in libcrypto|(?i)unexpected bytes remain after decoding|(?i)fatal: buffer_get_string: bad string|(?i)Local: crc32 compensation attack|(?i)bad client public DH value|(?i)Corrupted MAC on input)
(?:(?i) dropping source port zero packet from |(?i) denied AXFR from |(?i) exiting \(due to fatal error\))

(?:(?i)Connection refused: too many sessions for this address\.|(?i)Connection refused: tcp_wrappers denial\.|(?i)Bad HTTP verb\.|(?i)port and pasv both active|(?i)pasv and port both active|(?i)Transfer done \(but failed to open directory\)\.|(?i)Could not set file modification time\.|(?i)bug: pid active in ptrace_sandbox_free|(?i)PTRACE_SETOPTIONS failure|(?i)weird status:|(?i)couldn't handle sandbox event|(?i)syscall \* out of bounds|(?i)syscall not permitted:|(?i)syscall validate failed:|(?i)Input line too long\.|(?i)poor buffer accounting in str_netfd_alloc|(?i)vsf_sysutil_read_loop)
